title: Jimmy Butler ranked 17th best NBA player by ESPN
text:
Coming off a career year in which he led the Bulls in scoring, Jimmy Butler was ranked as Chicago’s best player by ESPN .
Butler comes in at No. 17 on the list , up all the way from No. 70 last year.
He placed one spot below Warrios forward Klay Thompson and one place ahead of Cavaliers point guard Kyrie Irving.
From ESPN :
What Butler did last season is incredibly difficult. He transmogrified from a defense-first wing with solid offensive skills limited to a low-volume arsenal of open jumpers and attacks off the dribble, to a full-service 2-guard and top-flight shot maker
Check out where all the Bulls ranked: Start Slideshow » From ESPN: What Butler did last season is incredibly difficult. Detroit Pistons guard Spencer Dinwiddie, left, and Chicago Bulls guard E'Twaun Moore chase the ball during the second half of an NBA preseason basketball game on Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015, in Chicago. The Pistons won 114-91. (AP Photo/Nam Y. Huh)
